summary: Medicare Advantage (MA) is a private-plan alternative to traditional Medicare. Medicare pays MA plans a monthly amount per beneficiary, and this amount is adjusted based on a beneficiary’s health status, among other things. As such, Medicare generally pays an MA plan more for a beneficiary in poorer health (who will likely have higher health care costs) than for a beneficiary in better health. We found...
title: Medicare Advantage: Benefits and Challenges of Payment Adjustments Based on Beneficiaries' Ability to Perform Daily Tasks
